org.spongepowered.api.data

Interface DataHolder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataSerializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Aerial, Ageable, Agent, Ambient, Animal, Aquatic, ArmorStand, Arrow, Banner, Bat, Beacon, Blaze, Boat, Boss, BrewingStand, CaveSpider, Chest, Chicken, CommandBlock, Comparator, ComplexLiving, ComplexLivingPart, Cow, Creeper, DaylightDetector, Dispenser, Dropper, Egg, EnchantmentTable, EnderChest, EnderCrystal, EnderDragon, EnderDragonPart, Enderman, Endermite, EnderPearl, EndPortal, Entity, ExperienceOrb, Explosive, ExplosiveProjectile, EyeOfEnder, FallingBlock, Fireball, Firework, FishHook, FlowerPot, Furnace, FusedExplosive, Ghast, Giant, Golem, Guardian, Hanging, Hopper, Horse, Human, IgnitableExplosive, IronGolem, Item, ItemFrame, ItemStack, Jukebox, LargeFireball, LeashHitch, Lightning, Living, MagmaCube, Merchant, Minecart, MinecartChest, MinecartCommandBlock, MinecartContainer, MinecartFurnace, MinecartHopper, MinecartMobSpawner, MinecartRideable, MinecartTNT, MobSpawner, Monster, Mooshroom, Note, Ocelot, Painting, Pig, Piston, Player, PotionEffect, PrimedTNT, Projectile, Rabbit, Sheep, Sign, Silverfish, Skeleton, Skull, Slime, SmallFireball, Snowball, SnowGolem, Spider, Squid, ThrownExpBottle, ThrownPotion, TileEntity, TileEntityCarrier, User, Villager, WeatherEffect, Witch, Wither, WitherSkull, Wolf, Zombie, ZombiePigman
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Location

    public interface DataHolder
extends DataSerializable
    A data holder object allows the access of additional data on the object that is not simply expressed by its basic type.

    For example, a chest block, which is of the chest type, also has inventory. This inventory is considered extra data, which can be accessed via getData(Class), provided that an implementation exposes that extra data.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.spongepowered.api.data.DataSerializable

        toContainer

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> Optional<T> getData(Class<T> dataClass)
        Gets an instance of the given data class for this DataHolder.

        If there is no pre-existing data that can be represented by the given DataManipulator class, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        dataClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class, if not available

      • getOrCreate

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> Optional<T> getOrCreate(Class<T> manipulatorClass)
        Gets or creates a new DataManipulator that can be accepted by this DataHolder. In the event that there is no data that can be represented by the given DataManipulator, a new DataManipulator object is created with default values.

        In the event the DataManipulator can not represent any data pertaining to this DataHolder, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        manipulatorClass - The data class
        Returns:
        An instance of the class, if not available

      • remove

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> boolean remove(Class<T> manipulatorClass)
        Attempts to remove the given DataManipulator represented on this DataHolder if possible.

        Certain DataManipulators can not be removed due to certain dependencies relying on the particular data to function.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data manipulator
        Parameters:
        manipulatorClass - The data manipulator class
        Returns:
        If the removal was successful

      • isCompatible

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> boolean isCompatible(Class<T> manipulatorClass)
        Checks if the given DataManipulator class is able to represent data within this DataHolder.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data
        Parameters:
        manipulatorClass - The data class
        Returns:
        True if this DataHolder can accept the DataManipulator object

      • offer

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> DataTransactionResult offer(T manipulatorData)
        Offers the given DataManipulator to this DataHolder.

        In the event that the DataManipulator contains data that would otherwise overlap existing data on this DataHolder, a default DataPriority.DATA_MANIPULATOR is used.

        If any data is rejected or existing data is replaced, the DataTransactionResult will retain the rejected and replaced data.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of manipulator data
        Parameters:
        manipulatorData - The manipulator data to offer
        Returns:
        The transaction result

      • offer

        <T extends DataManipulator<T>> DataTransactionResult offer(T manipulatorData,
                                                           DataPriority priority)
        Offers the given DataManipulator to this DataHolder.

        If any data is rejected or existing data is replaced, the DataTransactionResult will retain the rejected and replaced data.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of manipulator data
        Parameters:
        manipulatorData - The manipulator data to offer
        priority - The data priority to use
        Returns:
        The transaction result

      • getManipulators

        Collection<? extends DataManipulator<?>> getManipulators()
        Gets an copied collection of all known DataManipulators belonging to this DataHolder. An individual DataManipulator can be used for creating new data to replace on this DataHolder.
        Returns:
        A collection of copied data manipulators belonging to this data holder

      • getProperty

        <T extends Property<?,?>> Optional<T> getProperty(Class<T> propertyClass)
        Attempts to retrieve a specific Property type of this DataHolder. If the property is not applicable, Optional.absent() is returned.

        Propertys can define various immutable information about a DataHolder that is dependent on the instance of the holder. As Propertys cannot be changed, the DataHolder can not change the information about it's own properties either.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of property
        Parameters:
        propertyClass - The property class
        Returns:
        The property, if available

      • getProperties

        Collection<? extends Property<?,?>> getProperties()
        Gets an immutable collection of all known Propertys pertaining to this DataHolder.

        Propertys can not be changed such that the property is attached to the instance of the residing DataHolder.

        Returns:
        An immutable collection of all known Propertys

      • validateRawData

        boolean validateRawData(DataContainer container)
        Validates the container with known data required to set the raw data to this DataHolder. If the container is incomplete or contains invalid data, false is returned.

        This validation should be checked prior to calling setRawData(DataContainer) to avoid exceptions.

        Parameters:
        container - The raw data to validate
        Returns:
        True if the data is valid

      • setRawData

        void setRawData(DataContainer container)
         throws InvalidDataException
        Attempts to set all data of this DataHolder according to the DataContainer's held information. Using this to modify known DataManipulator is unsupported and if the data is invalid, an InvalidDataException is thrown.

        This setter is used to provide setting custom data that is not represented by the Data API, including forge mods and other unknown data. Attempts at validating known DataManipulators contained in the data container are made with the assumption that all necessary data exists.

        Parameters:
        container - A container containing all raw data to set on this data holder
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - If the container is missing or has invalid data that this holder will refuse
